DataElement.preferredDefinition: The emission scan start time recorded in the 24 hour format.  Precision can be truncated by omitting the seconds or both the seconds and minutes (23:59 or 23).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The begining of the discharge or emanation of data or image with a sensing device._The usual mode of scanner operation in which a tracer's distribution throughout a subject is detected for subsequent processing into an image.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The usual mode of scanner operation in which a tracer's distribution throughout a subject is detected for subsequent processing into an image.

Concepts.definition: The usual mode of scanner operation in which a tracer's distribution throughout a subject is detected for subsequent processing into an image.

Property.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

Concepts.definition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/13/13 Replaced C71894:C17999 with C94892 (Emission Scan). jc 10/8/13 removed "manually-curated" from definition. jc 1/13/09 Released to support C3D Adopter reuse request.  2/7/08 - updated emission for NCIt CUI.  2/6/08 - DEC updated.  12/20/07 created for ACRIN PET, U of  WASH FES, FMISO studies

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ISO 8061 time recorded as hh:mm:ss based on a 24 hour clock.   Precision can be truncated by omitting the seconds or both the seconds and minutes (23:59 or 23).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/30/17 jk transferred context; added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 8/29/13 curated for the CFR Standardization work. tt

ReferenceDocuments.name: Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: An example of time is 23:59:59 which represents the time one second before midnight. Precision can be truncated by omitting the seconds or both the seconds and minutes (23:59 or 23).

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElement.changeDescription: 10/9/13 added to PET Emission CRF CSI. jc 10/8/13 - definition updated; comment added to support Round 4 community comments. jc  2/21/12 New time format.
